lines.text: O'Pat!
What is it, O'Mike?
He's after our pot of gold, he is. Oh-ho-ho-ho!
The devil you say, O'Mike.
The devil I don't. O'Pat!
And *now* what is it, O'Mike?
We must hide the pot of gold, we must, we must.
[Runs around the room with the pot in his hands]
Hold on. Wait, stop. Here, now. Whoa. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. WAIT A MINUTE!
[O'Mike stops]
I'm Chief of the Leprechauns here about, and 'tis me alone is will decide how to treat the likes of this intruder. Is that clear, me boy-o?
Yes, O'Pat.

[Porky walks into his room]
Just put the bags down any place, Seamus.
[yawns, and gives OMike, who appears to be legs only, his coat and hat]
All this excitement, I am tired. Boy, am I tire-tire-t-pooped.
Pardon me sir, but have you seen the lower half of me abouts?
It's right back there, Seamus.
Thank you, sir.
S-some people just can't keep track of their other halves.
[Porky, shocked, does a double-take]
Now, isn't this sight enough to set the heart crossways in ye?

[high-pitched]
L-ll-l-leprechauns!
